title: TLS Tri-State Livestock logo
content:
I have one of the fonts Figured out… Ellington.. But what is the font that makes up the main  
“TLS” Especially the “S” Is this a mixed logo? more than one font or was it modified or what is going on with the “S” ?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=font2_0.jpg) | 26.11 KB |
author: amiart

comments.content: I would venture a guess that, whatever the typeface, the S is a chop job. If you look at the lettering within the bottom of the black circle, it appears to be the same style as the initials, but there the S is stylistically what one would expect to see with the other letters. The large S may be a reworked dollar sign, or a grafted inverted question mark.
I agree with Nick and would add that the font in question started out as Century Schoolbook.

_the font in question started out as Century Schoolbook_

Quite possibly: another source may well be Craw Clarendon Condensed. The bottom of the S might well come from the numeral 3 in that face.
